body:
### Describe the bug

Over on the weekly binary PyPy testing, I am seeing [an error](https://github.com/pypy/binary-testing/actions/runs/7771034626/job/21191877405#step:7:17577) when running `nogil_buffer_acquisition`:
```
Errors from shard 0:
======================================================================
FAIL: runTest (__mp_main__.CythonCompileTestCase)
[0] compiling (c/cy2) nogil_buffer_acquisition
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "D:\a\binary-testing\binary-testing\cy\runtests.py", line 1106, in runTest
    self.runCompileTest()
  File "D:\a\binary-testing\binary-testing\cy\runtests.py", line 1110, in runCompileTest
    return self.compile(
  File "D:\a\binary-testing\binary-testing\cy\runtests.py", line 1413, in compile
    self._match_output(expected_errors, errors, tostderr)
  File "D:\a\binary-testing\binary-testing\cy\runtests.py", line 1461, in _match_output
    self.assertEqual(expected, actual)
AssertionError: '5:15: Buffer may not be acquired without[47 chars]ead.' != "3:8: 'numpy.pxd' not found"
- 5:15: Buffer may not be acquired without the GIL. Consider using memoryview slices instead.
+ 3:8: 'numpy.pxd' not found
``` 

The test is missing a `#tag: numpy`: https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/c271bc7b1f86390447834c4063a6f618b5dca51e/tests/errors/nogil_buffer_acquisition.pyx#L1-L10

It was last changed over 10 years ago, so I wonder why I am seeing the failure only now. Surely someone must have run the test suite without NumPy before?

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```cython
# example code
```
python runtest.py nogil_buffer_acquistion

### Expected behaviour

I would expect the test to be skipped if NumPy is not installed.

### OS

All

### Python version

All

### Cython version

HEAD

### Additional context

_No response_
title: [BUG] missing `# tag: numpy` in nogil_buffer_acquisition test
